results.title: Mountain building
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Mountains are evidence which enable geologists to study not only the movements of the Earth’s plates, but the composition of the interior structure of the Mantle. The Rock cycle whereby material from and below the crust is metamorphosed is also explained which enables geologists to determined how land masses are created and fused together into larger parts, eventually becoming mountain ranges. Fossil evidence and magnetic forces enable the geologist to determine the age and structure of terrain.

results.title: The Boat that Ian built
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ian Bruce decided to build his own boat, a laser yacht. It proved to be a popular design so mass production in several countries was begun

results.title: Plate dynamics
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Although a relatively new accepted field in Geology, the theory of Plate Tectonics, has enabled geologists to understand the ways in which the Earth’s plates move and interact. Three types of plate movements have been analysed and involve convergence of two plates, the divergence of plates and in the case of geological phenomena like the San Andreas Fault, Transformation Faults whereby the continental plates are continually slipping past each other.

results.title: The Birth of a theory
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Addresses some controversial geological theories including the theories of Continental Drift and Plate Tectonics. It was only in the middle of the 20th Century that scientists accepted that the major continents were once joined and then drifted apart due to the geological activity occuring on and beneath the Earth’s surface. The study of the ocean floor provided valuable evidence which enabled the theory to eventually gain popular support.

results.title: The Sea floor
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The sea-floor is the focus of submarine geologists. Water covers 70% of the planet’s surface and contains many of tye minerals and elements which sustain life itself. The sea-floor is largely basaltic, while continental landmasses are largely granitic. Like the landmass on the planet surface, the sea-floor has a volcanic structure, which gives rise to its varying seascapes mid-oceanic ridges, ocean trenches and fracture zones. The use of deep sea robots have enabled submarine geologists to understand how old the sea floor is.

results.title: Earth's interior
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Earth revealed”.
Seismic waves, earthquakes and close study of rocks can give insight into the structure of the Earth. This episode looks at the field of geophysics in order to determine what the three composite parts which make up the Earth’s structure, i.e. the crust, mantle and core, are like. Measuring the magnetism in the Earth and its magnetic fields, looking at heat flow and measuring the Earth’s gravity are discussed. Geophysical research links the study of gravity, magnetism and seismology in order to fully comprehend the complexity of our planet.

results.title: The Blue yonder
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosman, Alan Shapiro, Annette Handley, Susan B Landau and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: 11-year-old Jonathan Knicks (Huckleberry Fox) is posed with an intriguing question about time travel by aviator/inventor Max Knickerbocker (Peter Coyote). He’s asking the wrong person, as Max is already an experienced time travellers thanks to the efforts of the time machine built by his neighbour, Henry Coogan (Art Carney). Unbenowst to Jonathan, Max is also his grandson and the time machine has allowed them to meet. Max learns that his discovery of the past and the fate of his grandfather forces him to decide whether to alter the course of the future. Also starring Dennis Lipscomb, Joe Flood and Mittie Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Rosman, Alan Shapiro, Annette Handley, Susan B Landau and Walt Disney Productions

He’s asking the wrong person, as Max is already an experienced time travellers thanks to the efforts of the time machine built by his neighbour, Henry Coogan (Art Carney). Unbenowst to Jonathan, Max is also his grandson and the time machine has allowed them to meet. Max learns that his discovery of the past and the fate of his grandfather forces him to decide whether to alter the course of the future. Also starring Dennis Lipscomb, Joe Flood and Mittie Smith.
description_for_label: 11-year-old Jonathan Knicks (Huckleberry Fox) is posed with an intriguing question about time travel by aviator/inventor Max Knickerbocker (Peter Coyote). He’s asking the wrong person, as Max is already an experienced time travellers thanks to the efforts of the time machine built by his neighbour, Henry Coogan (Art Carney). Unbenowst to Jonathan, Max is also his grandson and the time machine has allowed them to meet. Max learns that his discovery of the past and the fate of his grandfather forces him to decide whether to alter the course of the future. Also starring Dennis Lipscomb, Joe Flood and Mittie Smith.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Robert Lattanzio and Corporation for Community Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Earth revealed”.
This episode introduces the vast field of geology and the work undertaken by scientists in that and other related fields. Excellent visuals stimulate the viewer’s appreciation of the Earth and a broad overview is provided on Plate Tectonics, earthquakes, seismology and the origins of our planet.

results.title: The Blizzard of Aahhh's
results.brief_description: Take three of the world’s best stunt skiers - cliff-jumper Scot Schmidt, extreme skier - Bad boy Glen Plake, and precision skier Mike Hattrup … transport them to the finest steep terrain in the world - from Switzerland to France’s Chamonix Valley to California’s awe inspiring Squaw Valley … engage some slick cameramen … set the results to an original soundtrack ranging from hot rap to Euro-funk, including Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Propaganda and ACT … and what do you have? “The Blizzard of AAHHH’s” - a vividly photographed, tightly edited rock video movie. Ever bolder jumps, twists, straight shots through chutes, games of chicken with crevasses and other activities designed to make insurance company rate-setters squeal with delight! Rated: G

results.title: The Blue Planet (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, Dept of Marine Services and University of Sydney Television Service
results.brief_description: Looks at the oceans of the World and the development of, and basics of oceanography. Considers the effect and benefit of scientific study of the oceans for sailors, yachtsmen, surfers, environmentalists, scientists, engineers and architects.
